newsitem.title: UK: Med oil products - strong crude boosts gasoline.
newsitem.headline: Med oil products - strong crude boosts gasoline.

text.p: Mediterranean oil products were mixed on Friday, with high sulphur fuel and gas oil weaker on good supply and gasoline firmed by strong crude, traders said.
Gas oil was slightly softer was material widely offered and buying interest subdued.
Premiums to benchmark quotes for 0.2 percent sulphur heating oil slipped to around +50 cents cif Genoa.
Russian material flowed freely out of the Black Sea ports with no disruptions to liftings except for the closure for maintenance of product berth three for maintenance.
Offers for EN590 also eased amid slack demand.
Gasoline remained firm amid healthy demand out of Italy and Eastern Europe and healthy crude prices.
"I think prices are going to stay pretty firm into June and then maybe we'll see the market settle down a bit," said one trader.
Naphtha was steady in a quiet market although traders saw demand growing as the market moved into June.
Fuel oil was steady, with bunker demand diminishing, a steady flow of Russian material and continued interest in working high sulphur material to the Far East.
A cargo of high sulphur straight run from Turkey was heard sold to an unknown buyer. Bids were heard to be higher than plus $3 but the final sale number was not immediately revealed.
Low sulphur fuel jumped on a notional basis on the back of stronger swap markets in northern Europe and a cargo deal of British barrels heard done at $95 fob, a $5 jump on the previous level.
